intro: Sisymbrium ludovicianum, commonly known as the eastern wallflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as fields and woodland edges, and it is known for its bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Sisymbrium ludovicianum has pinnately divided leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is an important plant for pollinators and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
